The '''Great Hall of Feasts''' ([[Sindarin]] '''Merethrond''')<ref name=Partings>{{RK|Partings}}, p. 975</ref> was a feasting-hall to the right (i.e. north) of the [[Tower of Ecthelion]] in the [[Citadel of Gondor|Citadel]], the topmost seventh circle of walls of the city of [[Minas Tirith]].<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Citadel'', p. 515</ref><ref>{{SD|Partings}}, p. 67 citing from a plan of the Citadel that was drawn by J.R.R. Tolkien on a manuscript</ref>

==History==
On [[July 18]] {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Chief}}, entry for the year 3019, July 18, p. 1095</ref> [[King of Rohan|King]] [[Éomer]] of [[Rohan]] returned to [[Minas Tirith]] with an [[éored]] of his knights and participated in a feast that was held by the recently crowned King [[Aragorn]] in the Great Hall of Feasts.<ref name=Partings/>

==Etymology==
''Merethrond'' is a Sindarin name,<ref name=Eldamo>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-396735149.html|articlename=S. ''Merethrond'' pn.|website=Eldamo|accessed=2 May 2023}}</ref> which means "Great Hall of Feasts"<ref name=Partings/> or "Hall of Feasts".<ref name=SA>{{S|Appendix}}, entry ''mereth''</ref> The first element of the name is ''mereth'' ("feast").<ref name=SA/> Paul Strack suggests that the second element is ''[[rond]]'' ("vaulted or arched roof", "large hall or chamber so roofed").<ref name=Eldamo/>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Merethrond is present in all three main versions of Minas Tirith, but is the most prominent during [[Mid-year's Day|Midsummer]] when it hosts the Banquet after the royal wedding of [[Aragorn]] and [[Arwen]].
